page.title: 20GRIM'S DYKE GOLF CLUB
page.content: The club is named after a ditch (or dyke) believed to start in Cambridgeshire.It was opened in 1910 by SIR WILLIAM GILBERT,their first president.At that time there were 9 holes,there are 18 now.80 acres are grass and 3 are trees.The club's 600 members pay a membership fee of Â£276+VATfor men and Â£210+VATfor women (double first year).The grounds almost meet those of Hartsbourne Golf Club. Their main trophy is a priceless medal presented by SIR WILLIAM GILBERT.It resides almost permanently in the safe.Juniors are encouraged to take a group lesson on Saturday afternoons. The Club has a "MEN ONLY" bar which shows how few women play golf! They are trying to encourage more lady members to join.
